intro: Eremanthus reflexoauriculatus, commonly known as the auriculate eremanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, reflexed leaf lobes that give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, yellowish to orange flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and specialized collections.
